examples: A network of roads crisscrossed the country.
The many species that live in the forest canopy constitute a network of life via their complex interactions.

subdefinitions.definition: A set of people with sociocultural connections to one another; especially, such a set consisting of occupational or business connections.
examples: To get a job in today's economy, it is important to have a strong network .
For people with mental health challenges, having a support network of family and friends can improve the chances of maintaining successful mental health care.

subdefinitions.definition: A group of affiliated television stations that broadcast common programs from a parent company.
A computer network : multiple computers and other devices connected together to share information.
examples: The copy machine is connected to the network so it can now serve as a printer.

definitions.definition: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals; the act or process of making such an object.

secondary_definitions: ( literal ) A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals; the act or process of making such an object.
